page.title: 06Industry-service employment.
page.content: There are few opportunities for employment inside the area. Even farming which is highly mechanised and family run employs very few people. The 1981 census shows less than two percent employed in agriculture. The area is influenced and indeed dominated by the nearby towns and industries. People travel out of the area to work in factories such as Smiths aerospace and in the shops and offices of Cheltenham. The majority of people work in service industries; insurance, banking, local government and the Government Communications Headquarters in Cheltenham are all particularly important. The motor car has allowed the wealthier members of society a much greater freedom of choice as to where they live and work.
